blogs.title: TCS Common Coding Questions – Complete Guide
blogs.author: Gonotes

content.text: TCS National Qualifier Test (NQT) is a standardized assessment conducted by Tata Consultancy Services for recruiting fresh graduates across India. It acts as the initial screening for multiple entry-level roles.
About TCS National Qualifier Test (NQT)
The test is open to graduates from AICTE/UGC recognized institutions including B.Tech, B.E, M.Tech, M.E, MCA, and M.Sc candidates.
TCS NQT 2025 – Key Information
Registration is open until 23rd March 2025. The exam starts from 15th March 2025 and is conducted at TCS iON centers.
Test Pattern

The exam consists of two parts: Foundation Section (Numerical Ability, Verbal Ability, Reasoning Ability) and Advanced Section (Advanced Quantitative & Reasoning, Advanced Coding). Total duration is 190 minutes.
Career Tracks Based on Performance
Based on performance, candidates qualify for Prime, Digital, or Ninja roles. Prime requires top performance, Digital focuses on advanced technical skills, and Ninja is for standard developer roles.
